comments:
With Milestone 4, Eclipse 3.1 I get the error message below, when using the Web 
Service Client wizard. 
I select "Java Proxy", a WSDL-file from a local project and after selecting the 
server and clicking "next" I get the error.

I have got exactly the same Problem using:

Eclipse 3.1 and WTP RC1

What server are you selecting, and what kind of project is your WSDL document 
in?

I upgraded to Eclipse 3.1 final and now the problem appears also without  
selecting a server.  
I get the error after selecting the WSDL file and clicking "next" or "finish".  
The WSDL file is in a Java Project.

I also saw this problem. I'll describe my configuration to see if that shines 
any light on the situation.

I installed Java 1.4.2, eclipse 3.1, WST RC1 (and it's sub components), Apache 
Tomcat 5.5. I also installed Tomcat 5.5's compatibility library because the 
default Tomcat 5.5 only works on Java 5.0.

I then ran the web services tutorial of creating a web service from the bottom 
up using java. I went through the steps perfectly until this exception 
occurred, when the code was trying to create the client.

The scenario described in the opening comments of this bug (regarding selecting 
a WSDL file in a Java project and launching the client wizard) was fixed in bug 
101337. I tried the scenario in the M4 driver and can reproduce it. I tried it 
on RC1 and the problem is gone.

With respect to comment 5 about problems with the bottom-up tutorial, I tried 
that on the RC1 driver an encountered the following NullPointerException (see 
below - it's different from the one posted in the opening comments of this 
bug). This NullPointerException has been fixed in bug 103796. This fix did not 
make it into RC1 so I would recommend trying it on the next declared 
integration/stable build.

Resolved 14 months ago as working with no activity since. Verified as fixed on behalf of submitter. Please resubmit if the problem recurs on WTP 1.5.1 or higher.
